children.subject: +1. I'm a EECS junior that's taking EE16A this semester and I was planning on taking 16B next semester, but from the current policy I'll be waitlisted until the adjustment period...?
CS people don't even need to take EE16B, so I don't understand why spots are being reserved for them instead of EECS...
+1 need this class to graduate next semester :(((
+1 This doesn't really seem fair for upperclassmen who need EE16B to graduate (freshman have 4 years to take it and it's not a prerequisite for many CS classes)

EE16AB were created by the faculty to be a freshmen-level course, which is why the priority is being emphasized at the first and second-year levels. You are right that LSCS students are not required to take EE16B, however they may substitute it for their Math 54 requirement, which is why spots are being held for them. 
We are well aware that many EECS students were not able to take 16A in their first, second, and even third years. If you are an EECS student graduating in the spring and still need to take 16B, you will be able to take this class. 16B has had one less semester than 16A so it is still tricky to predict enrollment trends, however this class has had lower enrollment than anticipated every semester it's been offered.
This policy is reflective of when both 16A and 16B are in a "steady state" and we no longer have many 3rd- and 4th-year students in EECS and LSCS needing to take the classes in order to graduate on time.
**Follow-up: If you are EECS and planning on graduating early, you must talk to an ESS advisor or Sarah, Nicole, or myself to verify this and then contact me for enrollment.**

Thank you for the detailed response, Lydia. So if I'm currently a third year EECS major that's not planning on graduating early (but would like to take 16B next semester to get it over with), should I still phase one it? I fear that phase I-ing it may be a waste with the current registration system given that I might have to end up dropping and re-adding later anyway if the section I'm in fills up, since I won't be able to get in the class until the adjustment period anyway.
can someone answer this followup ^^ im in a similar position
+1 to the question above!! Same situation
Are seats in EE 16B not being reserved for EECS seniors anymore?

Sorry-EECS sophomores were listed twice by mistake.

We are saving seats for EECS sophomores so you may use Phase II units for 16B.

What does "Fall sophomore EECS major may enroll directly into this class." mean? What is a Fall sophomore EECS major? Does that mean that if I took EE16A this semester, I will be able to enroll directly into 16B? Or do I fall into the category of second-year EECS majors?

Essentially, should I phase 1 this class, or would it be safe for me to phase 2 it?

Hi Anon, these courses have always been open to any undergrad. We may revisit restricting them to EECS majors if it becomes a problem. As of now, we don't have many non-EECS trying to take these courses.

Hi Sarah, the website seems to suggest otherwise -

"Due to the increase in popularity of EE courses, we suggest using your Phase I units for many of the most impacted EE courses (including, but not limited to: EE 105, EE C106A/B, EE 120, EE 126, and EE 127)."

Is this demand coming purely from within EECS?
It's mostly coming from within EECS, yes. Some other COE majors take our classes as well, but well over the majority are EECS/CS students.

I'm wondering as to the logic of opening all upper division EE courses to any undergraduate student. If upper division EE courses have been experiencing an increase in demand, shouldn't EECS majors get priority enrollment? Opening it to all nullifies the benefit of being an EECS major to take EE classes.
For LSCS 2nd-year students, I would recommend using Phase I units for 16B.
Is it safe to Phase II this class for an L&S CS-intended freshman?
Do I have an alright chance of getting into EE16A phase 2 as a declared L and S 2nd year? Or do seats fill up too fast and I'd be better off picking the class during phase 1?
I will be a graduating senior next semester, and need to take EE16B. Should I phase 1 or phase 2 16B? Will there be seats reserved for graduating seniors?

history.content:
Please see our new EE enrollment page to help answer some Phase I vs. Phase II questions for Spring '17: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/eecs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

There are no permission codes for EE classes next semester.
